column4: is there a log somewhere of what is happening when you are starting the live cd ? It goes to a bash for a reason
has someone had some problems with 8.1 when booting the cd and choosing to install on a lappy ?
I guess one or two people have experienced some difficulties. Anything in particular that's occuring on your system?
it's going straight to the command prompt after the laoding screen, this is when running the live cd and i have no idea what i can do from there
I see. Have you tried running with the pci=no-acpi boot option?
What does the log say about starting X?
i doesn't even go that far
I see. Would you mind telling me where it stops?
i'm downloading the alternate and i ll try that, i can tell you the content of the log next time i try but if i remember correctly it was something about bios pnp

ie. do you have a command prompt where you can type commands? Does the screen blink at all before you are given the prompt? Have you tried pressing F1 during boot to see the actual messages? Do they give you any sensible errors?

i can see the loading bar, and then it goes into the command prompt after 15 sec, minimal stuff with "box" in the name, i can't remember the exact prompt name, but no error execpt the bios pnp stuff which is i believe a warning
Well that doesn't sound like an acpi bug...
yeah i just said the problems i had with my previous version, but it was installing fine
Have you checked the integrity of the disc?
yes and i tried with kubuntu and ubuntu live cds
Do you get an error that sais that the kernel is not suitable for your computer?
Then I'm all out of ideas, sorry.
no worries, and i get no info on the forums about that
